name: Monk Parakeet
description: A medium-sized parakeet with a long tail. Its basic coloration is green-gray, with a light red beak and gray legs. Males and females look alike.
food_note: Seeds, fruits, and buds of various trees and shrubs
image_alt: Monk Parakeet, photo: Raul Antonio Alvarez
proportions: Body length 13.5–14.5 cm; tail length 12.5–14.5 cm; weight 90–140 g
reproduction: Females lay 5–6 eggs, incubated for 24–25 days.
attractions: They earned their name from their lifestyle. They are social, living and nesting in colonies of individual pairs and their offspring. Each pair builds enclosed nests from twigs and sticks close to neighboring pairs, forming a fairly large 'housing estate,' where empty older nests are used for resting by unpaired individuals.
breeding: We have kept monk parakeets continuously since 1991 and have been breeding them since 1993.
